rev.desc.rev.desc: SRC should have more friendly message when operator reach "Max logins" limit
SRC should have more friendly message when operator reach "Max logins" limit
Memory leak shows on Hummer when running security folder related case
add value: $L.return.action to field: return action
Unrecoverable error when we reset the password
SRC users need be able to change their password after the password expires
invoke RTE new function setLoginError for password expired, and will stop invoke web service or reset password for background login.
1.change exit for panel: reset.bypass.name from : check.exit.code to log.errorlogin
expire.password in $operator=true and not nullsub(never.expire.pass in $operator, false)
expire.password in $operator=true and not nullsub(never.expire.pass in $operator, false) and $L.authMode="db"
Modifield panel=init.name to remove the variable $L.language
Modified panel=setup.language to simplify the code and delete the duplicates
Allow configuration of separator character to use on number fields
Allow configuration of separator character to use on number fields
Allow configuration of separator character to use on number fields
QCRQ1E57546 WS login may pass the language to the RTE which set the language. We need to have the language code set in $G.my.language
The login application does not need to setup a menu for a Web Service user in ESS mode
The RTE now performs the check to validate that the ESS user is using the ESS URL
Remove duplicate calls to apm.global.initer for lists Languages Supported, Operators
ยง In login app on panel get.list.1 it sets up lists that were needed on old login forms. These are no longer needed and should be removed.
QC ReqId: 53652 - Set and use $lo.operator throughout the application instead of selecting operator record repeatedly.
if (same(NULL, $L.language) and same(NULL, syslanguage in $lo.operator)) then ($L.language=sysinfo.get("languagecode"))
expire.password in $lo.operator=true and not nullsub(never.expire.pass in $lo.operator, false)
use.max.pwd.life in $G.system.info="logins" and max.life.by.logins in $G.system.info>user.login.count in $lo.operator
use.max.pwd.life in $G.system.info="time" and password.date in $G.system.info>=tod() - password.date in $lo.operator
Adds a call to sysinfo.get("languagecode") in setup.language in the case that $L.language and the operator's language are both null.
Force users who reset their passwords to re-login.(DE3854)
Removed updates to the operator record. This is handled by the RTE.
Removed code associated with SAF and RACF.
Removed checks for $disallow and 2 in version().
Changed logon panel of the login application
if (message.flag in $operator=true) then if (message.count in $operator>0) then ($messages=messages(0, message.count in $operator);$messages=messages(1))
Returned back to condition prior to previous changes.
if (message.flag in $operator=true) then if (message.count in $operator>0) then ($messages=messages(0, message.count in $operator);$messages=messages(1))
Added user self registration, login rad app now displays ess.register app to allow user to enter in data. This shows ess.self.register form and registers using "Self-Service" javascript code.
Moved ESS check to before the login form is displayed.
Removed "Operators" from global lists to be fetched.
Modification made for DevTx ticket I0235.
Enabled the capability to allow the user to specify that their initial application to be displayed is the ESS menu.

Modification made to the cleanup panel so that if it is an ESS user logging in, and neither the ESS menu nor the ESS option is specified on the operator record, they get defaulted to ESSSM and option 1 (Submit a Request), respectively.
Previous change was for SCR 15863, task 19044 not a shown below.
operator()=name in $operator was added to setup.language panel so if a mixed case password is entered at login, then it will default to the value in the operator record. SCR 31101, task 29445

RAD change login app: On the check.password panel change the first condition: From : expire.password in $operator=true To: expire.password in $operator=true and not never.expire.pass
The dbdict change: Add new logical field never.expire.pass
Format Change: Add check box Never Expire Password.
I also added an exit to set.last.login if never.expire.pass=true that way it will not call the password reset applictaion in the foreground.
Added the following process line to the set.last.login panel:
Changed the query on the get.fc panel to:
On the qbe.operator panel, changed the following process line from:
Modified so that SOAP API has a different path then trusted signon.
Removed references to pfmap() and calles to set.fixed.keys application.
On quiesce.check the order of operators has been reversed to improve performance.
Avoid going to menu manager when using Open API interface.
Added password parameter for Open API interface.
Added support for setting $G.multi based on the multi.company field in the info record. login.DEFAULT format control will still be able to override this setting.
Setup a global variable copy of the info record for system information (System Information Record) - $G.system.info
Changed 4th condition on check.password to fix a problem with not setting the expiration conditions correctly?
Modified the message numbers as per betatrak IM00013.
Modified to check if the expire.password is set. If so, it will force the user to change their password when login in.
User Locking Information doesn't update when a user changes from Inactive to Expired. Updated the login application to make the correct change. ST18274

It was exiting the login application due to the max login attemts number being met. I modified it so that it checks first for lockouts, and once that info has been set, it will check for max login attempts.
Moved all related language settings from qbe.operator to a new panel setup.language
Changes to update operator record with lock.until date when a user is locked out for failed attemts.
Changes made to send messages to log when login attempt is failed.
Do not error out if apm.global.initer fails.
No changes, modified set.login.globalvars to set $G.max.attach.size.
modified qbe.operator to not set $L.language if login.prompt is bypassed. And to only send Language to the server is $L.language is not null.

Modified qbe.operator: Set user's language to first found of: entered on screen, company default, english. Also, set $G.my.language to which of those three were selected, rather than only setting it when the op picked one themselves.
Modified: build the $G.language* lists for text as
well; give them the list on the screen.
Default the System Language to the language in the info.company record.
Casual users can now change their password if it has expired.
sets up english as "en" instead of null
Sets the $G.root.currency variable based on the company record. Default is "USD" (US Dollar)
Changed the parameter value passed into password.change on panel set.new.password to $old.password instead of password in $operator so that if securepassword is set it will work.
Check USER not ALL on quiesce check.
Removed $L.login.good statements and subroutined saf messages.
Added a flag to allow use of old pre9802 printing routines.
